Are there any any biologists, wildlife documentarists/photographers or wildlife enthusiasts that would like to discuss wildlife topics?

post_info.post_title: Any Biologists or wildlife enthusiasts amongst?

Learning to be biochemist and microbiologist, does that count? emoticon_frazzled
Microbio and ecology/evolution: gonna forget about the microbio when I graduate though.....field work is much more interesting

Well, didn't this thread draw a plethora of responses!
 
 But to answer your question, yes, there are biologists here. And wildlife biologists to boot. I suspect that I had moved on to other things before any of you were born.
Molecular Genetics, suppose it is fairly close

I sometimes like to read sites like environmentalchemistry.com
 
 or visionlearning.com 
 
 Does that count?
Well, I am now in medicine, with a strong background in biology, and a strong interest in Evolutionary Theory. And in my now non-existing sparetime, I used to do a lot of birding.

While not a learned student of wildlife biology, I am interested in and fascinated by birds of prey, especially eagles, hawks and owls. I'll go out of my way to watch documentaries on them.
 
 Please enlighten me with your posts.
